skill.name: rn-observability
skill.description: Logging, error messages, and debugging patterns for React Native. Use when adding logging, designing error messages, debugging production issues, or improving code observability.
skill.summary: Logging, error messages, and debugging patterns for React Native. Use when adding logging, designing...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown patterns and code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external commands. Skill provides observability guidance only.

content.value_statement: Silent failures create debugging nightmares. Use logging patterns, error message design, and structured debugging techniques to diagnose production issues fast.
actual_capabilities: Generate structured logging functions with context objects
Design error messages with diagnostic information
Implement flow tracing for multi-step operations
Add state snapshots for debugging complex flows
limitations: Does not execute code or access file systems
Does not connect to external logging services
Does not modify existing code automatically
Provides patterns only, user must implement

prompt_templates.title: Basic logging setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Add logging to a new React Native function
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a structured logger for React Native with debug, info, warn, and error levels. Include a logging wrapper that respects environment (debug in dev, warn in prod). Use the rn-observability patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Write error handling for a data fetch function using rn-observability patterns. Include function name, what failed, relevant state, and possible cause in error messages.

prompt_templates.title: Flow tracing
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement flow tracing for a multi-step operation in React Native. Use flow IDs, step logging, and error capturing. Follow rn-observability patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Secure logging
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a secure logging utility that redacts sensitive fields like passwords, tokens, and API keys before logging. Use rn-observability patterns.

output_examples.input: Add logging to this function that saves user answers
output: logger.info('[saveAnswer] Saving answer', { questionId, value, skillArea, existingAnswerCount })
logger.warn('[saveAnswer] Dropping answer - skill area not in retake set', { questionId, skillArea, retakeAreas })
throw new Error('[saveAnswer] No answers found. Completed: X, New: Y. This may indicate a timing issue.')

best_practices: Log every early return with why it returned and relevant context
Include function name, diagnostic state, and hypothesis in error messages
Use flow IDs to trace multi-step operations across async boundaries
Redact sensitive data before logging to prevent credential exposure
anti_patterns: Silent early returns without logging why execution stopped
Generic error messages without diagnostic context
Console.log without structured data for searching
Logging sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or API keys

faq.question: Which React Native versions are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns work with React Native 0.70+ using modern TypeScript and async/await patterns.

faq.question: What logging levels should I use?
faq.answer: Error for exceptions, warn for unexpected conditions, info for business events, debug for diagnostics.

faq.question: Can this integrate with Sentry or Crashlytics?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the captureError pattern to send errors to services while maintaining local logging.

faq.question: Is sensitive data safe with these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes when using the secureLogger pattern with redaction for keys like password, token, and apiKey.

faq.question: Why are my logs not appearing in production?
faq.answer: Check log levels. Production typically uses warn/error only. Use captureError for production visibility.

faq.question: How is this different from React Native Debugger?
faq.answer: This provides code patterns for persistent observability. Debugger is for interactive debugging sessions.
